inventoryPage.title: Food Inventory
inventoryPage.subtitle: Manage your food supplies and view feeding suggestions.
inventoryPage.accessDenied: Inventory access is reserved for Breeder users.
inventoryPage.fetchFailed: Error loading inventory, please contact support
inventoryPage.submitDenied: The feature is not reserved for the plan associated with your account

hero.title: Your platform to manage reptiles
hero.subtitle: SnakeBee was created to simplify the daily management of snake, gecko, and other reptile breeding. Everything in one app.

1.title: Register your reptiles
1.desc: Add information about species, morph, sex, and photos.

2.title: Manage feeding and health
2.desc: Track meals, sheds, feces, and vet visits with one click.

3.title: Organize breeding
3.desc: Plan pairings, births, and monitor baby growth.

dataSafety.title: SnakeBee keeps your data safe
dataSafety.desc: A simple, fast interface designed for breeders.

services.title: What you can do with SnakeBee

list.reptileManagement2: Weight, feeding, health events, and documentation.
list.notifications2: Automatic emails for feedings and event reminders.
list.organizedData2: Filter by species, sex, age, morph, and more.
list.inventory2: Manage stocks of mice, rats, and chicks with breeder access.
list.calendar2: Unify feedings, health events, breeding, and custom events.
list.export2: Download all your breeding data in Excel or PDF format.
list.stats2: Analyze success rates, incubation, and feeding trends.

management.title: 🦎 Reptile Management
management.desc: Complete records for each animal with data on weight, diet, moults, veterinary visits, and official documents (CITES, microchip).

breeding.title: 🐍 Reproduction
breeding.desc: Organize pairs, add events (ovulation, laying, hatching), track babies, and get statistics on success and incubation.

notifications.title: 📩 Automatic Notifications
notifications.desc: Receive email reminders about scheduled meals and important events. In the future: customizable notifications for every need.

inventory.title: 🥩 Food Inventory
inventory.desc: Manage your supplies: automatic decrement with meals, quantity controls, and management of multiple food types.

calendar.title: 📅 Calendar
calendar.desc: All your data together: meals, health events, breedings, and custom events in a single view.

export.title: 📊 Exports
export.desc: Download detailed Excel and PDF files with animal records, meal history, events, breedings, and babies.

stats.title: 📈 Stats
stats.desc: Discover rejection rates, average molt intervals, reproductive success rates, and other useful metrics.

futureGoals.title: What we want to build
futureGoals.desc: SnakeBee is just starting, but we have big goals. We want to become the reference point for reptile breeders in Italy, offering more advanced tools, an active community, and a complete ecosystem.

about.title: About us
about.desc: SnakeBee was born from the idea of a reptile enthusiast, with the goal of creating a simple but powerful tool for those who, like us, have turned this passion into part of their life. The entire platform was developed from scratch, without funding, without a team, just with determination and love for this world. Our mission is to offer something concrete and useful to the Italian community of breeders, professionals, and enthusiasts.

googleCallback.warning: Missing access token. Please try logging in again.

forgotPassword.error: Error in the request, please contact support

calendarModal.title: Event Calendar
calendarModal.subtitle: View and manage your events.
calendarModal.multiSelectHint: Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Cmd (Mac) to select multiple reptiles

subscriptionPage.title: Choose your Plan
subscriptionPage.subtitle: From the first steps to professional management: find the perfect plan for your farm and simplify your work 🐍🐢🐊

neophyte.title: NEOPHYTE
neophyte.description: Get started with no obligation: discover the basic features and get familiarity with the platform.
features: Up to 5 basic events (molting, weight, feces, visits) per reptile

apprentice.title: Apprentice
apprentice.description: Advanced management for those expanding their collection and wanting to stay organized.
features: Up to 15 basic events per reptile
Email reminders for feeding and activity

practitioner.title: Practitioner
practitioner.description: The ideal choice for serious breeders: more tools, more control, more efficiency.

breeder.title: Breeder
breeder.description: The ultimate for professional breeders: unlimited management and tools Exclusive.
features: Detailed PDF report for each animal
QR code and public link for each animal

tips: Some reptiles need UVB spots for metabolism and strong bones 🦎☀️
Ever thought of environmental enrichment? Tunnels and hides reduce stress 🐢
Remember: half the terrarium should be cooler, the other warmer 🌡️ for thermoregulation
Lizards and geckos love to climb! Add steps or branches to stimulate them 🦎
Dust insects with calcium, don’t press it in. Better to dust every time 🐛🧂
Frequent cleaning prevents mold: remove feces and old shed daily 🧼
A snake’s forked tongue is for ‘smelling’ the environment, not just for style 😏
Chameleons don’t change color just to ‘camouflage’ — it’s for temperature control or communication 🎨
Never handle a snake right after it has eaten. It just had a royal feast 👑🐍
Don’t keep two males in the same terrarium. If they don’t fight, they ignore each other… or worse 👊
Humidity for a ball python should stay between 50–60%. Too much can cause mold and infections 💧
During shedding, don’t force the snake’s skin. Offer a tub of warm water instead 🛁
Turtles do NOT hibernate randomly. It requires temperature and monitoring, or it’s life-threatening ❄️
Did you know? Snakes don’t have eyelids. What you see is an ‘eye scale’ 🐍👁️
Never put your hands in a terrarium right after handling food. Now you’re the snack 🍗➡️🖐️
Some lizards can regrow their tail, but it’s not an infinite trick. Careful! 🔁
Clean the water bowl regularly: many bacteria love stagnant water 🚰
Reptiles aren’t ‘cold-blooded’: they are ectothermic! They use external heat 🌞
Never feed prey bigger than the snake’s head. It’s a mouth, not a suitcase 🧳🐍
A terrarium without hides is like a house without a bathroom: unlivable 😅
Not all reptiles bite… but the ones that do have perfect aim 😬🎯
Some snakes hiss or blow. They’re not angry — just drama queens 🐍💨
Don’t use scented substrates. Reptiles don’t want to live in an air freshener 🌲😵

quizzes.question: What’s the difference between a boa and a python?
reactions: Oops, go back to Wikipedia 🐢
Nope! Scales don’t matter here 🧩
Correct, wise reptile! 🐍✨

quizzes.question: Why do chameleons change color?
reactions: No, it’s not just camouflage! 🦎
Exactly! You’re a camouflage expert 🧠🎨
Hmm, this isn’t a fashion show 😅

quizzes.question: Which of these is NOT a reptile?
reactions: No, geckos are reptiles 🦎
Correct! The axolotl is an amphibian 🐸
Nope, monitor lizards are serious lizards 🦖

quizzes.question: How do snakes hear sounds?
reactions: Correct! They have inner ears connected to the skull 🎧🐍
Not quite… tongues are for smell 👅
Wrong! They sense vibrations, they’re not deaf 😌

quizzes.question: What is ‘brumation’ in reptiles?
reactions: Nope! They’re not moonwalking 🕺
Correct! It’s a type of hibernation in reptiles 💤
Don’t confuse it with shedding! 📜

quizzes.question: What can cause an incomplete shed?
reactions: No, light doesn’t matter much here 🌞❌
Perfect! Humidity is needed for a clean shed 💧
Small food = bad shed? Not really 🤏

quizzes.question: Reptiles have… blood
reactions: No, that’s mammals 🐻
Correct! They’re ectotherms, use external sources 🌡️
Nah, it’s a general rule 🔁

quizzes.question: Why do snakes stick their tongue out so often?
reactions: It’s not just bad-guy attitude 🐍😎
Thermoregulation is another story 🌡️
Exactly! It’s their way of ‘sniffing’ the air 👅🧪

quizzes.question: How long can an adult ball python live?
reactions: Too short! It’s not a hamster 🐹
Closer, but still short 🕰️
Yes! They can live over 25 years 🐍🎂

quizzes.question: What is the function of claws in land turtles?
reactions: They’re not Wolverine 🐢❌
Correct! They love to dig burrows and holes 🕳️
Nope, they’re not geckos 😅

quizzes.question: What happens if you handle a snake right after it has eaten?
reactions: Affectionate, maybe, but give it time 😅
Correct! It might regurgitate from stress 🤮
Nope, stress makes it nervous, not docile 😬

quizzes.question: Do leopard geckos have eyelids?
options: No, they use their tongue to clean their eyes
reactions: Right! They’re one of the few geckos with true eyelids 💤
Those without eyelids do that, but not leopard geckos 🦎👁️
Haha you just made that one up 😂

quizzes.question: What type of light is needed for vitamin D3 synthesis in reptiles?
reactions: No, LEDs look nice but are useless for this 😎
Correct! UVB is essential for bones 💡🦎
Infrared heats, but doesn’t help with calcium 🔥

quizzes.question: Can a snake close its eyes?
options: No, it has an eye scale
reactions: Nope, no eyelids for them 😴❌
Exactly! They have a transparent scale over the eye 👁️🐍
If they could, they’d judge you with closed eyes 😆

quizzes.question: What is a typical behavior of a stressed reptile?
reactions: Yawning can mean something else, not stress 😬
Correct! It’s a defense or escape mechanism 🏃‍♂️🐢
If it sings, sell it to Netflix 🎤🦎

quizzes.question: Which substrate is *dangerous* for snakes?
reactions: Newspaper isn’t pretty, but at least it’s safe 🗞️
Correct! Sand can cause intestinal blockages 🚫🐍
Coconut works fine if kept clean 🥥

quizzes.question: How often does a healthy snake shed, on average?
reactions: Too little… they shed more often! 🔁
Weekly?! It’s not Spider-Man 🕸️
Correct! About once a month if growing normally 🐍

quizzes.question: What does a forked tongue in snakes indicate?
reactions: They breathe through their nose, not tongue 👃
Perfect! It’s like having two movable noses 😁
Nope, they’re not influencers 😅

quizzes.question: What’s the ideal warm-side temperature for a ball python?
reactions: Too cold, poor python 🥶
Correct! Perfect for digestion and activity 🔥🐍
Too hot: it’s cooking itself 😨

quizzes.question: What happens if a reptile doesn’t get enough calcium?
reactions: No, albinism is genetic 🎨
Correct! Calcium is vital for the skeleton 🦴🦎
Tail loss has other causes (and mostly just geckos) 🔁
